Operation 'post_/request' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, not_actionable, poor_ai_interpretability. Original description is severely lacking. It only mentions the protocol format without explaining the operation's purpose, what requests can be sent, what responses to expect, or how to use it. Missing summary entirely. Added: (1) clear action-oriented summary, (2) explanation of the socket-based streaming nature, (3) list of supported request types from schema context, (4) input/output expectations, (5) clarification that this is persistent socket connection, (6) reference to schema conformance. This enables AI agents to understand when to use this operation and what to expect.

data.current_description: This is a socket protocol delimited by CRLF (not http)
data.description_suggestion: Sends a request message to the Betfair Exchange Streaming API over an SSL socket connection. Messages must be CRLF-delimited JSON. Supported request types include authentication, heartbeat, market subscription, and order subscription messages. Each request should conform to the RequestMessage schema. The server will respond with corresponding ResponseMessage objects containing market changes, order updates, connection status, or authentication confirmation. This is a persistent socket connection, not HTTP-based.
data.reasoning: Original description is severely lacking. It only mentions the protocol format without explaining the operation's purpose, what requests can be sent, what responses to expect, or how to use it. Missing summary entirely. This enables AI agents to understand when to use this operation and what to expect.
